title: 111_s3421
content: The Act titled "Protecting Against Indebting our Descendants through Fully Offset Relief (PAID FOR) Temporary Extension Act of 2010" extends unemployment insurance provisions. The PAID FOR Temporary Extension Act of 2010 amends various dates related to unemployment insurance provisions. The PAID FOR Temporary Extension Act of 2010 modifies dates in unemployment insurance provisions, changing deadlines to later dates in 2011. The PAID FOR Temporary Extension Act of 2010 includes amendments to the Continuing Extension Act of 2010, with an effective date retroactively applied. SEC. 3 extends COBRA benefits eligibility period to June 30, 2010. SEC. 4 increases Medicare physician payment update. SEC. 4 amends the Medicare physician payment update dates. SEC. 5 extends the use of 2009 poverty guidelines. SEC. 6 extends the National Flood Insurance Program. SEC. 6 extends the National Flood Insurance Program to June 30, 2010. SEC. 7 extends the Small Business Loan Guarantee Program. SEC. 7 extends the Small Business Loan Guarantee Program with an appropriation of $60,000,000 for fee reductions and loan guarantees until June 30, 2010. SEC. 8. Use of stimulus funds to offset spending by rescinding unobligated balances from the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 to offset the net increase in spending. $13 billion to be rescinded pro rata. Director of the Office of Management and Budget to report amounts rescinded to congressional committees. SEC. 9. Determination of budgetary effects. The budgetary effects of this Act will be determined by the latest statement submitted in the Congressional Record. The Act is designated as an emergency for pay-as-you-go principles and statutory PAYGO requirements. The Act, except for section 4, is an emergency requirement under the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010.
